title.value: Влияние скармливания новых комбикормов-концентратов для ремонтных телок 4-6-месячного возраста на продуктивные и гематологические показатели
Effect of feeding 4-6 months of age replacement heifers withnew feed concentrates on performance and hematological indices
Effect of feeding 4-6 months of age replacement heifers withnew feed concentrates on performance and hematological indices

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Tsaj, V.P., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: Feeding efficiency of compound fodder-concentrate with input of the basic components of local manufacture, probiotic (the Biomix-vet and Y-CAK) and prebiotic (the Bio-Mos) preparations, allowing to balance a ration of young growth of large horned livestock on energy, protein and mineral substances in diets structure of repair heifers in the age of 4-6 months is certain in the lead scientifically-economic experience. The use of diets with our feeds for growing 4-6-month-old heifers contributed to obtaining of 856-874 g of average daily weight gain while reducing feed costs by 5,7-9,2%, and the prime cost of produce by 4,4-16,9%. Morphological and biochemical blood indices of young animals at rearing support their relationship with the level of energy, protein and mineral nutrition providing the conditions for intense growth and development according to the planned performance. Results of researches have shown, that in blood of 6-month's calves with change of forages in a diet, inclusion of balancing additives, and also the preparations promoting to digestibility increase of rations' nutrients and as consequence, its best comprehensibility, occurs its saturation by erythrocytes on 2,4-2,8%. Concentration of ferriferous globular protein thus is fixed over analogues of the control over 3,5-4,4% that testifies to intensity of nutrients exchange
